translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka, translated by Jñānagupta and others

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時，復見彼諸聽法大眾，以天人花及眾寶物而散佛上；及諸菩薩而聽法已，復更出生種種音樂雜色衣服供養世尊，以諸衣服覆世尊上，還坐本處而共聽法。
translation: At the time, I also saw those members of the congregation who were listening to the teaching scatter flowers and other treasures from gods and humans on top of the Buddha, and after they listened to the teaching, the bodhisattvas then produced various musical and colorful garments to offer to the Bhagavān, covered the Bhagavān with those garments, returned to their original seats, and listened to the teaching together.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時復作是念：『嗚呼諸佛神通無礙！
translation: At the time, I also thought, 'Aah! The buddhas' supernormal powers are unimpeded!'

source_sentence: 思惟信入隨順而行。』
translation: He contemplates, believes, enters, and follows along.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我聞此說無礙法聲，即入覺知，而說偈言：「『我覺寂靜時，　　無有障礙處，　　即脫一切苦，　　而得不動樂。』
translation: When I heard this teaching of the unhindered sound of the Dharma, I immediately entered into awakening and spoke the verse, saying, 'When I am calm, there's no place for obstructions, which frees me from all suffering and attains immovable bliss.'

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時復於空中，見如來身，聞說是言：『汝善男子！
translation: Once again, I saw the Tathāgata's body in the air and heard him say, 'You good sons!

source_sentence: 汝莫捨意，汝應更信諸佛神通勤求信入。
translation: Don't let go of your mind; you should put more faith in the Buddha's powers and diligently seek to enter them with faith.

source_sentence: 汝善男子！
translation: You good sons!

source_sentence: 汝於長夜無智愚癡，恒為欺誑受苦惱故。』
translation: For a long time, you were ignorant and foolish, and you were constantly deceived and subjected to suffering and distress.'

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時聞是語已，復生恐怖身毛皆竪，一心思惟求佛神通。
translation: After I heard those words, I was again terrified, and my hair stood on end as I focused my thoughts on seeking the Buddha's supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 我思惟時，即見三千大千世界，所有草木樹林花果皆悉開敷，好色香潔甚可愛樂，世間天人阿修羅等以花散佛，而供養已還沒不現。
translation: When I was thinking about it, I saw a world of 3,000 great one-thousand worlds in which all the grasses, trees, forests, and flowers and fruits were in bloom, and their beautiful colors and fragrances were so lovely that gods, humans, asuras, and others in the world scattered flowers to the Buddha and returned without showing up after making offerings.

source_sentence: 復有諸果香潔無比，復見世尊左手執鉢，以取諸果滿於鉢中。
translation: Again, there are fruits of unsurpassed fragrance, and the Bhagavān is seen holding a bowl in his left hand and filling it with fruits.

source_sentence: 又見世尊於臍中出諸化菩薩，從於鉢中而取果已，遍至十方阿僧祇等諸世界中，授與無量諸佛世尊，彼世尊鉢皆悉盈滿。
translation: The Bhagavān also saw transformation bodhisattvas emerge from their navels, take the fruit from the bowl, and then go to one of the incalculably long worlds in the ten directions and give it to measureless Buddhas and World Honored Ones, whose bowls were all filled to the brim.

source_sentence: 我見彼佛世尊食時，臍中復出諸化菩薩，身皆金色眾相莊嚴。
translation: When I saw that Bhagavān eating, out of his navel came transformed bodhisattvas whose bodies were golden and adorned with a variety of appearances.

source_sentence: 從身出已，我復見彼諸世界中，有諸菩薩及諸眾生，以彼諸果奉獻供養。
translation: After they emerged from their bodies, I also saw bodhisattvas and sentient beings in those worlds offering up offerings of those fruits.

source_sentence: 既奉獻已見彼食時，彼等食已皆悉得成如來形相，至餘世界無佛之處，於彼演說般若波羅蜜法要，教化成熟無量眾生住於菩提，諸佛法中勤修不斷，為說法故彼等還沒，如來鉢中果還盈滿。
translation: After making these offerings, I saw that when they ate, they all attained the Tathāgata's form and went to some other world where there were no buddhas, taught them the essentials of the prajñāpāramitā dharma, matured measureless sentient beings who abide in enlightenment, diligently cultivated them in the teachings of the buddhas, and returned to them for the sake of teaching the Dharma, and the fruit in the Tathāgata's bowl was replete.

source_sentence: 復見此果從鉢出已，供養一切世間眾生，充潤自身皆至佛所，頂禮佛足右繞三匝，合掌恭敬却住一面，從世尊所聞無所有解釋法相，一心聽受更無所見，更無有智。
translation: Seeing this fruit emerge from the bowl, he makes offerings to all the world's sentient beings, enriches himself, goes to the Buddha, bows his head at his feet, circles him three times to his right, joins his palms in respect, and stands to one side, he hears from the Bhagavān an explanation of the teaching's characteristics that has nothing to offer, listens with a concentrated mind, sees nothing further, and has no more knowledge.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我亦如是聽入隨順如所說行，我如是知我身與佛，及此大眾空無可說。
translation: Thus I listened, entered, and complied with the practice as explained, and I thus knew that my body, the Buddha, and this great multitude were empty and inexpressible.

source_sentence: 如是念時，有一佛像起語我言：『汝善男子！
translation: When I thought this, a Buddha image arose and said to me, 'You good man!

source_sentence: 此是諸佛大德神通。』
translation: These are the great supernormal powers of the buddhas.'

source_sentence: 我於彼時所得諸想我想不行，亦無歡喜亦不怯弱。
translation: The conceptions of self and ideas I had at the time didn't work, and I wasn't joyous or fainthearted.

source_sentence: 我唯信入諸佛神通，如是思惟：『願諸眾生未入者入，未度者度。』
translation: I only believed in the Buddha's supernormal abilities and thought, 'May all sentient beings be entered by those who haven't entered yet, and saved by those who haven't been saved yet.'

source_sentence: 我發是心：『願諸眾生於佛神通圓滿無缺。』
translation: I aroused this thought, 'May all sentient beings attain the Buddha's supernormal powers in full and without fail.'

source_sentence: 我時亦復無眾生想。
translation: At the time, I also had no conception of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 然我於佛大神通不可破壞，為諸眾生及此大眾令成熟故，作如是言：『嗚呼諸佛大德神通！
translation: Still, since the Buddha's great supernormal powers are indestructible, I ripened them for the sake of sentient beings and this great assembly, saying, 'Whoo-hoo! The Buddha's great supernormal powers!'

source_sentence: 如是希有我今乃見，然佛神通亦無增減。』
translation: Now, I've seen such a rare thing, but the Buddha's powers don't increase or decrease.'

source_sentence: 「彼時復見空中有佛，作如是言：『汝善男子！
translation: "Again, he saw a Buddha in the sky and said, 'You good sons!

source_sentence: 更求信入諸佛神通。』
translation: He further seeks to believe and enter into the Buddha's supernormal powers.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時一心信入諸佛神通，一心念時即見諸佛神通力故，一切眾生即一眾生，一眾生即一切眾生，然彼一切我亦不見。
translation: At the time, I single-mindedly believed in the Buddha's supernormal powers, and when I single-mindedly remembered it, I saw the Buddha's supernormal powers, so that all sentient beings were one sentient being and one sentient being was all sentient beings, but I didn't see them all.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時作如是念：『諸佛神通不可思議！
translation: At the time, I thought, 'The Buddha's powers are unfathomable!'

source_sentence: 如我見佛大神通等。』
translation: 'Just as I've seen the Buddha's great supernormal powers, so ...'

source_sentence: 我於彼時更求諸佛大德神通亦無厭足，我求彼時更轉信入更復專念，思惟觸證令增廣故。
translation: At the time I sought those buddhas' great supernormal powers, I didn't tire of them, so when I sought them, I turned my faith into them and concentrated on them again, reflecting on them, touching them, and realizing them so that they would increase.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時見此三千大千世界四方所有毘富羅山，佛及四眾天人修羅，諸世界等皆成大海，清淨無濁更無餘相。
translation: At the time, I saw this mountain range of three thousand great one-thousand worlds in the four directions of Vipula, the buddhas, the four celestials, humans, and titans, and all the worlds formed into a vast ocean that was pure and unsullied with no other characteristics.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時復作是念：『嗚呼諸佛神通如是！』
translation: At the time, I also thought, 'Whoo-hoo! The buddhas' supernormal powers are like this!'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我念佛神通時，即見世尊坐彼水中而水不著。
translation: When I remembered the Buddha's powers, I saw the Bhagavān sitting there in the water, and the water didn't stick.

source_sentence: 我復見有菴摩羅果，及菩提果無所缺壞，繞佛三匝住在佛前，佛為說法，復說諸佛大神通等。
translation: I also saw a mango fruit and the fruit of enlightenment that had nothing missing, who circled the Buddha three times and stayed in front of him while he taught Dharma and explained the great supernormal powers of the buddhas.

source_sentence: 為說法時成菩薩形，頂禮佛已即沒不現。
translation: When he was teaching, he took the form of a bodhisattva, paid homage to the Buddha, and then disappeared.

source_sentence: 復見世尊在毘富羅山為眾說法，如是略說乃至成火，又成螢火，又復成風、大毘羅果，是則成地如大母指。
translation: Again, I saw the Bhagavān teaching the crowd on Mount Vipula, which was described in brief as becoming a fire, then a firefly, then a wind, then a great fruit of vairocana, and then becoming a ground like a large mother's finger.

source_sentence: 一切世間即一世間，一世間即一切世間，彼諸世間復成無智彼則真體。
translation: All the worlds are the one world, and the one world is all the worlds, and those worlds again become the true essence of that which has no wisdom.

source_sentence: 我於彼時於佛神通如是觸證，思惟是已不生疑惑。
translation: At the time, I thus came across the Buddha's supernormal powers and realized them, and after contemplating them, I didn't have any doubts or delusions.

source_sentence: 亦不恐怖心慮不行。
translation: Nor did I become frightened, nor did my thoughts or anxieties fail.

source_sentence: 「爾時，有一如來形像在我前住，而謂我言：『汝善男子！
translation: "At the time, there was an image of the Buddha in front of me, and he said to me, 'You good sons!

source_sentence: 於幾時行六波羅蜜，而能信此佛大神通廣思惟證？』
translation: At what point do you practice the six perfections and are able to believe in the realization of this Buddha's great supernormal powers and extensive discernment?'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於彼時白彼佛言：『如所言六波羅蜜者。
translation: I then said to that Buddha, 'Such is the claim about the six perfections.

source_sentence: 為是何謂？』
translation: What do they mean?'

source_sentence: 彼告我言：『所謂檀波羅蜜、尸波羅蜜、羼提波羅蜜、毘梨耶波羅蜜、禪波羅蜜、般若波羅蜜。
translation: He told me, 'They're called the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of kṣatriya, the perfection of vīrya, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of prajñā.

source_sentence: 汝善男子、如是名為六波羅蜜，行已當得證入諸佛大神通中，汝已成佛大神通已。』
translation: You good sons, this is called the six perfections, and after practicing them you will realize that you've entered the great supernormal powers of the buddhas, after you've achieved the great supernormal powers of the buddhas.'

source_sentence: 「我時白言：『是故，世間諸天及人阿修羅等，聽我今說，現今世尊為我證明，於諸法中得無礙智。
translation: "I then said, 'Therefore, the gods, humans, asuras, and so forth of the world have listened to my present teaching, and the Bhagavān has now testified for me that I've attained unimpeded knowledge of all phenomena.

source_sentence: 世尊現知，如我今說，我未曾行六波羅蜜，而得證於佛大神通。
translation: The Bhagavān now knows that, as I've explained, I've never practiced the six perfections and yet I've realized the Buddha's great supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 我今始聞六波羅蜜，我本前際墮黑闇中不可得知。
translation: Now that I've first heard about the six perfections, I was previously trapped in darkness and couldn't know them.

source_sentence: 今見世尊及無所有菩薩所問，世尊解釋，我既聞已於諸法中無復黑闇，於諸陰聚分別法中得無所著。
translation: Now, when the Bhagavān and the peerless bodhisattvas asked me about them, the Bhagavān explained that after hearing them, I would no longer be in darkness among the things, and I would attain freedom from attachment among the various aggregates and distinctive qualities.

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「『我得寂靜智，　　無復有所著，　　今已脫諸苦，　　現得不動樂，　　寂靜無比智，　　寂無有所寂。
translation: He spoke the verse, saying, 'I've attained the knowledge of quiescence, I have no more attachments, I've escaped suffering, and now I've attained the joy of immovability, the incomparable knowledge of quiescence, and the quiescence of nothing.'

source_sentence: 為何事布施？
translation: What is the purpose of this offering?

source_sentence: 多百爾所劫，　　我無布施行，　　已證無比寂。
translation: For hundreds of eons, I haven't given generosity, and I've realized unsurpassed quiescence.

source_sentence: 布施中何作？
translation: What is the act of making a gift?

source_sentence: 彼施不為寂，　　寂靜無比智，　　寂無有寂處。
translation: "Their charity isn't quiescent, quiescence has no comparable knowledge, and quiescence has no place in quiescence.

source_sentence: 為何事持戒？
translation: For what purpose do they observe the precepts?

source_sentence: 多百爾所劫，　　我今不持戒，　　已證無比寂。
translation: For hundreds of eons, I didn't observe the precepts now, but I've realized incomparable quiescence.

source_sentence: 寂中無持戒，　　戒亦不為寂，　　已知無比寂，　　所寂無寂處。
translation: There's no observance of the precepts in stillness, and the precepts aren't stilled; I've known comparable stillness, and there's no place for that stillness.

source_sentence: 為何事修忍？
translation: What is the purpose of cultivating forbearance?

source_sentence: 多百爾所劫，　　我今不修忍，　　已證無比寂。
translation: For hundreds of eons, I didn't cultivate forbearance now, but I've realized unsurpassed quiescence.

source_sentence: 寂中何所忍？
translation: What is there to endure in that quiescence?

source_sentence: 忍亦不為寂，　　已知無比寂，　　所寂無寂處。
translation: "Tolerance is not quiescent, but it's known to be incomparably quiescent, and there's no place for that quiescence.

source_sentence: 為何而精進？
translation: Why does he exert himself?

source_sentence: 多百爾所劫，　　我不行精進，　　已證無比寂。
translation: For hundreds of eons, I didn't apply effort, and I've realized incomparable quiescence.

source_sentence: 寂中用進為，　　寂滅無精進，　　已知無比寂，　　所寂無寂處。
translation: Their effort is applied in quiescence, cessation is lacking in effort, they've realized incomparable quiescence, and there's no place for that quiescence.

source_sentence: 為何而修禪？
translation: Why is it that I'm cultivating meditation?

source_sentence: 多百爾所劫，　　我今不修禪，　　已證無比寂。
translation: For hundreds of eons, I didn't practice meditation now, but I've realized unsurpassed quiescence.

source_sentence: 於中用禪為？
translation: What's the use of meditation in this?

source_sentence: 寂中無禪定，　　已知無比寂，　　所寂無寂處。
translation: "There's no meditation in stillness, no comparable stillness that's known, and no place where that stillness is known.

source_sentence: 為何修智慧？
translation: Why does he cultivate wisdom?

source_sentence: 多百爾所劫，　　我未修智慧，　　已知無比寂。
translation: For hundreds of eons, I've known peerless cessation before I cultivated wisdom.

source_sentence: 於中用智為？
translation: What's the use of wisdom in this?

source_sentence: 寂中無智慧，　　何用施戒忍，　　精進及禪定，　　智慧等諸度，　　何用多所行？
translation: What is the use of generosity, discipline, tolerance, effort, meditation, and other perfections of wisdom when there is no wisdom in tranquility?

source_sentence: 我以無智故，　　已知寂無比，　　於中智何作？
translation: I have known that cessation is incomparable because I have no cognition, so what do I do with that cognition?

source_sentence: 寂中無用智。
translation: "Knowledge of the uselessness of quiescence.

source_sentence: 願為我解釋，　　所有諸法中。
translation: 'May you explain for me that among all the dharmas, there's an omniscience that's self-permeating, honored one that doesn't know.

source_sentence: 一切智自在，　　尊無不知者。』
translation: There's no one who doesn't know that omniscience is self-permeating, honored one.'

source_sentence: 彼問此義已，　　兩足尊為釋：　『如實真如等，　　不散亦不合，　　不取亦不捨，　　汝今應當知。
translation: After he asked about the meaning of this, the Venerable Two-Pedestined explained, 'Such things as true natures are not dispersed or unconfined, and they are not grasped or abandoned, which you should now know.

source_sentence: 於中及自他，　　當更無有疑，　　知佛神通已，　　則離於我想，　　亦復無言說，　　自身捨無上。
translation: Among them and for yourself and others, there should be no more doubt, and after knowing the Buddha's supernormal powers, you'll be free of the notion of self, and you won't have to say anything, for your own abandonment is unsurpassed.

source_sentence: 覺佛神通已，　　一切罪皆滅，　　滅已無熱惱，　　故名持戒者。
translation: After realizing the Buddha's supernormal powers, all sins cease, and after they're ceased, there's no agitation; therefore, they're called a practitioner of the precepts.

source_sentence: 聞佛神通已，　　彼言大神通，　　如實無思慮，　　彼名忍辱者。
translation: After hearing about the Buddha's superknowledge, he says, "Great superknowledge, as it really is, has no deluded thought, so he's called a tolerant person.

source_sentence: 覺佛神通已，　　彼心無怯弱，　　更復生精進，　　故名精進者。
translation: After realizing the Buddha's supernormal powers, their mind isn't fainthearted, and they furthermore generate effort, so they're called someone who makes effort.

source_sentence: 覺佛神通已，　　彼心不散亂，　　捨一切諸相，　　故名禪定者。
translation: After realizing the Buddha's supernormal powers, their mind isn't distracted, and they abandon all appearances, which is why they're called someone who meditates.

source_sentence: 覺佛神通已，　　彼不著三界，　　超越諸障礙，　　故名智度者。
translation: After realizing the Buddha's supernormal powers, he doesn't attach to the three realms and transcends the obstacles, so he's called someone who has wisdom and salvation.

source_sentence: 是行一切處，　　諸度調伏者，　　覺知一切佛，　　是名佛神通。』」
translation: He who practices in all places and is disciplined by all the liberations, realizing all the buddhas, is called someone who has the Buddha's supernormal powers."

source_sentence: 爾時，惡心難調害人者，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At the time, the person whose evil thoughts were difficult to control said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 一一諸佛法教難覺，微少智者更深思惟。」
translation: Each of these buddha-teachings is difficult to realize, and the least intelligent person reflects on it more deeply."

source_sentence: 而說偈言：「若有聞觸證，　　云何覺神通？
translation: He then spoke the verse, "If we hear, touch, and realize, how do we realize the supernormal powers?

source_sentence: 彼當能滿足，　　是等諸六度，　及助菩提法。
translation: They will be able to fulfill these six perfections and the factors that aid in enlightenment.

source_sentence: 何謂佛神通？
translation: What's called a buddha's superknowledge?

source_sentence: 有何實體相？
translation: What is its physical appearance?

source_sentence: 彼有何色住？
translation: What kind of form does it have in its abode?

source_sentence: 云何而得證？」
translation: How can this be realized?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊以偈，報彼惡心難調害人者言：「若有自覺知，　　自已無眾生，　一切法中智，　　彼是佛神通。
translation: The Bhagavān then responded to that person with a verse about the difficulty of controlling evil thoughts, saying, "If someone knows on their own that they themselves are not sentient beings and have knowledge of all dharmas, this is the Buddha's supernormal power.

source_sentence: 眾生有著心，　　教於空法中，　如是教眾生，　　當得佛神通。
translation: Teaching sentient beings with attached minds to emptiness in the Dharma will then give them the Buddha's supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 眾生有著心，　　當一心普覺，　亦不當發心，　　此是佛神通。
translation: When sentient beings have attached minds, they'll be universally enlightened with one mind, and they won't arouse their minds either; this is the Buddha's supernormal power.

source_sentence: 所有諸佛剎，　　即知一佛剎，　彼此不相入，　　此是佛神通。
translation: To know that there are all buddha bases, that is, one buddha bode, and that they don't enter each other, this is the Buddha's supernormal power.

source_sentence: 知諸法不生，　　能發菩提心，　諸眾生一生，　　故言佛神通。
translation: Knowing that dharmas don't arise and being able to give rise to the mind of enlightenment and the lifetime of sentient beings is called the Buddha's supernormal power.

source_sentence: 忍言為神通，　　忍法體亦盡，　入於一切法，　　亦無有所住。
translation: He calls it the supernormal power of patience, which also ends the essence of the Dharma of patience and enters all dharmas without any abiding in them.

source_sentence: 彼住佛神通，　　一切法無疑，　無疑無生法，　　故彼得授記。
translation: He abides in the Buddha's supernormal powers, has no doubt about all things, and has no doubt about unarisen things, so Peter grants him assurance of assurance.

source_sentence: 成熟眾生故，　　當清淨佛剎，　於多劫修行，　　當得佛智故。
translation: As he matures sentient beings, he'll purify the buddha-blossom, and after many eons of practice, he'll attain buddha-wisdom.

source_sentence: 覺知諸佛空，　　一切最為上，　度佛法彼岸，　　成熟眾生故。
translation: He'll realize the emptiness of the buddhas, making them the greatest of all, and will cross over to the other shore of the Buddha's teaching in order to ripen sentient beings.

source_sentence: 佛聲及神通，　　文義皆能證，　於祕密教中，　　即得度彼岸。
translation: The Buddha's voice and supernormal powers are all realized in text and meaning, and in the esoteric teaching, they immediately reach the other shore of salvation.

source_sentence: 無邊不可取，　　亦無遍知者，　如是佛神通，　　無復有邊際。
translation: Without limit or desirability, and with no omniscience, such Buddha's supernormal powers have no further limit.

source_sentence: 若自此證已，　　即是勝布施，　一切施中上，　　更不生惡處。
translation: If someone has realized this, they're an excellent donor, the best of all donations, and they won't give rise to bad places.

source_sentence: 能行一切施，　　彼常行施時，　無有分別知，　　亦無有所住。
translation: When he always gives, he has no discriminating knowledge and doesn't have any abiding when he's always giving.

source_sentence: 覺知是教已，　　彼無物不捨，　於一切生中，　　是故捨一切。
translation: After realizing this teaching, there's nothing they don't abandon, and in all births, they therefore abandon everything.

source_sentence: 若聞此法已，　　能捨於我想，　取已無所著，　　是為最上檀。
translation: If someone who has heard this teaching can abandon the notion of self and doesn't attach to anything after apprehending it, this is the supreme giving.

source_sentence: 聞已無熱惱，　　身心得寂靜，　是為最上戒，　　更無有勝者。
translation: After hearing it, he has no anguish and attains quiescence of body and mind, which is the highest precept, and there's nothing better.

source_sentence: 於一空法中，　　無忍無諍競，　是為最勝忍，　　於中無上者。
translation: In a single empty dharma, having no tolerance and no strife is the most excellent tolerance, and there's no superior among them.

source_sentence: 知諸法空已，　　無有怯弱心，　是為勝精進，　　於中無過者。
translation: Knowing the emptiness of all dharmas and having no faltering mind is superior effort, and there's nothing wrong with it.

source_sentence: 於空常不亂，　　一切心發覺，　此是快禪定，　　唯聲中示現。
translation: Always unconfused about emptiness, he discovers all minds, and this is the pleasant concentration that's shown only in sounds.

source_sentence: 若於空不怖，　　一切智無想，　離睡眠無知，　　是智為最上。
translation: If he's not afraid of emptiness, his knowledge of all things is without conception, and he's free of drowsiness and ignorance, this knowledge is the greatest.

source_sentence: 是等諸度行，　　入於是教中，　若知無言說，　　彼即度諸度。
translation: These are the practices of salvation that enter into this teaching, and if they are known and not spoken, they are the salvation of all salvations.

source_sentence: 不壞於諸法，　　亦無有逼惱，　彼即知正法，　　無功用智定。
translation: Not destroying dharmas or having constrictions, he then knows the right dharma and concentrates on the knowledge of effortlessness.

source_sentence: 不壞於諸法，　　亦無有逼迫，　無知寂靜故，　　度於施彼岸。
translation: They don't destroy qualities, and there's no constraint; because of the quiescence of nescience, they're liberated on the other side of giving.

source_sentence: 若不壞諸法，　　亦不逼諸法，　此是最勝戒，　　一切戒中上。
translation: If he doesn't destroy things and doesn't constrain things, these are the most excellent precepts, the highest of all the precepts.

source_sentence: 若不破壞物，　　於非法亦然，　如是無疑已，　　更不墮惡道。
translation: If it doesn't destroy things, it's the same for what's not the Dharma; after thus not doubting, they won't fall into a bad path.

source_sentence: 若忍無盡故，　　覺一切有為，　此是最勝忍，　　斷一切鬪諍。
translation: If forbearance is inexhaustible, he'll perceive all existent things, which is the most excellent forbearance, and he'll end all quarrels.

source_sentence: 常習近是忍，　　晝夜不休息，　如是身觸證，　　當得可喜色。
translation: When he always cultivates this kind of forbearance, he doesn't rest day and night, and when he thus personally experiences it, he'll attain a pleasing appearance.

source_sentence: 若修習空時，　　不生勞倦意，　是即上精進，　　捨一切懈怠。
translation: If he doesn't become weary when cultivating emptiness, this is the highest form of effort, and he abandons all laziness.

source_sentence: 如是彼精進，　　若能身觸已，　即名上精進，　　一切無過者。
translation: If this is the kind of effort that's achieved by physical contact, it's called superior effort, and there's nothing wrong with it.

source_sentence: 不著於空法，　　及與禪寂滅，　此是最勝空，　　遠離諸覺觀。
translation: Not being attached to the dharma of emptiness and the cessation of meditation, this is the most excellent emptiness, free from perception and contemplation.

source_sentence: 是中禪喜者，　　彼捨諸煩惱，　如是身觸已，　　即無有輕躁。
translation: This is the joy of meditation, which is to abandon the afflictions, and after thus touching it physically, there's no agitation.

source_sentence: 若於內外法，　　無所有依著，　此是最勝智，　　無有智能散。
translation: If there's no attachment to internal or external dharmas, this is the most excellent knowledge, and there's no intelligence that's dispersed.

source_sentence: 當觀一切法，　　若無有智處，　如是觸知已，　　不染著諸世。
translation: He should observe all things as if there were no place for cognition, and after thus touching and knowing them, he won't be defiled by attachments to the world.

source_sentence: 如是如實知，　　常能一切施，　亦無一切施，　　彼無有所取。
translation: Knowing them as they really are, they are always able to give to all, and they don't give to all, so they don't grasp anything.

source_sentence: 諸法無所有，　　即是諸法體，　彼無所觸已，　　名為財富者。
translation: Those dharmas lacking possessions are the essence of dharmas, and when they lack anything to touch, they're called wealthy people.

source_sentence: 若思能清涼，　　善修於平等，　無有諸怯弱，　　斷疑遍普照。
translation: If he can be cooled in thought, he well cultivates equality, has no faltering, and cuts off doubt completely.

source_sentence: 清淨住戒中，　　彼無有熱惱，　若無有所證，　　彼戒無所轉。
translation: They abide purely within the precepts, have no anguish, and if they don't have any realization, the precepts will not change.

source_sentence: 解脫如虛空，　　更無有所見，　如虛空清淨，　　故彼無惡作。
translation: Their liberation is like space, and there's no view of anything, like the purity of space, so they do no wrongdoing.

source_sentence: 無所見諸法，　　而求無上道，　為諸眾生故，　　所起煩惱處。
translation: Without seeing any dharmas, they pursue the unsurpassed path, and for the sake of sentient beings, that's where the afflictions arise.

source_sentence: 不見彼彼身，　　不見彼身時，　煩惱無縛處，　　解脫皆如夢。
translation: When they don't see their bodies, and when they don't see their bodies, the afflictions are unfettered, and their liberation is like a dream.

source_sentence: 更無所復見，　　彼無亦不見，　是故名如夢。
translation: There's nothing more to see, and nothing is seen by them; therefore, it's called like a dream.

source_sentence: 如是諸言說，　有無等差別，　　聲覺觀分別，　如空不可取。
translation: Thus, these words, which make an equal distinction between existence and nonexistence, are observed and discerned by śrāvakas as empty and ungraspable.

source_sentence: 持戒與破戒，　善趣及惡趣，　　癡虛妄分別，　是處無真實。
translation: Observing precepts and violating precepts, good and bad destinies, and deludedly discriminating them, this place has no reality.

source_sentence: 猶如鏡中像，　分別故見彼，　　於彼無所有，　色體實如是。
translation: They're like an image in a mirror, which is discriminated and thus seen, and in which there's nothing, and whose form is really like this.

source_sentence: 如是內計我，　士夫不可得，　　內既無所有，　外亦不可得。
translation: Thus, an internal conception of self is unobtainable by a man, and since it doesn't exist internally, it's also unobtainable externally.

source_sentence: 此是如如教，　是故言為空，　　若能知空者，　彼當證寂滅。
translation: This is the teaching of thusness, which is why it's called emptiness, and if someone can know emptiness, they'll realize cessation.

source_sentence: 色從因緣生，　彼色無實體，　　若緣彼無有，　彼無無有因。
translation: Form arises from causes and conditions, and that form has no substance; if those conditions are nonexistent, they have no cause and nothing at all.

source_sentence: 無因故不生，　本性空寂靜，　　無取亦無捨，　無棄亦無似。
translation: Because it has no cause, it doesn't arise, is inherently empty and quiescent, has neither appropriation nor dispossession, and has neither discarding nor resemblance.

source_sentence: 若證是無二，　一切根能忍，　　若得如是忍，　彼當速成佛。
translation: If they realize that there are no two, they'll be able to tolerate all faculties, and if they attain such tolerance, they'll quickly become buddhas.

source_sentence: 我如是知已，　得見然燈佛，　　於後授我記，　汝往當成佛。
translation: After I thus knew this, I was able to meet Randamāṇa Buddha, who later gave me his prediction that you would become a buddha in the future.

source_sentence: 若有善男子，　及以善女人，　　彼覺如是等，　則亦當不難。
translation: If there are good sons and good women who perceive this and so forth, it won't be difficult for them either.

source_sentence: 若有善女人，　欲轉於女身，　　應如是知身，　即得具足願。
translation: If there's a good woman who wants to transform the body of a woman, she should thus know the body, and she'll attain the fulfillment of the vow.

source_sentence: 好色甚端正，　見者生歡喜，　　丈夫富伽羅。
translation: Their good looks are so correct that those who see them are delighted, and they become a rich man.

source_sentence: 覺知如是教，　　正行正念者，　聞持已能思，　　名智慧丈夫，　為眾決疑網。
translation: He perceives this teaching, correctly conducts himself with right mindfulness, and after hearing and upholding it, he's able to contemplate it, which is called a man of wisdom who resolves webs of doubt for many people.

source_sentence: 若有多眾生，　疑惑無定意，　　欲求於智慧，　彼能為斷疑。
translation: If there are many sentient beings who have doubts and uncertain intentions and want to pursue wisdom, he'll be able to help them end their doubts.

source_sentence: 若住不正道，　令彼住正路，　　幽冥諸眾生，　能為彼照明。
translation: If they stand on an incorrect path and are made to stand on the right path, he'll be able to illuminate the darkness of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 所有受生處，　一切處得明，　　為眾生愛樂，　覺知此教故。
translation: All the places where they're born will be illuminated, and they'll perceive this teaching for the delight of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 壽命得長遠，　諸根悉具足，　　常生勝族姓，　眷屬皆隨順。
translation: They'll have a long life, their faculties will be fully developed, they'll always be born into a superior clan, and their retinue will be obedient.

source_sentence: 隨何等生處，　為一切利益，　　并餘眾生等，　悉令住菩提。
translation: According to whatever birthplace it is, for the benefit of all, it will cause the rest of sentient beings and others to abide in enlightenment.

source_sentence: 若聞是等法，　能速自證見，　　諸眾生應當，　常恭敬奉事。
translation: If they hear these things and quickly realize them for themselves, sentient beings should always respect and serve them.

source_sentence: 應當作福田，　堪受一切施，　　常為善丈夫，　為世間支提。
translation: They should be regarded as fields of merit, capable of accepting all gifts, always a good person, and a factor of enlightenment for the world.

source_sentence: 住於諸佛前，　於一切勝施，　　無上世尊邊，　彼等堪施主，　　降伏諸世間，　當為作福田。
translation: Stand before the buddhas, bestow gifts, and reach the limit of the unsurpassed world-honored one, who's a worthy donor, subdues the world, and will be a field of merit.

source_sentence: 若聞如是法，　能勤修速證，　　一切諸佛教，　此修多羅說。
translation: If someone hears such a teaching and diligently cultivates it and quickly realizes it, this is the sūtra that teaches all Buddhas.

source_sentence: 如是覺菩提，　如如無分別，　　為此益法教，　當行菩提行，　　阿僧祇劫數，　聞是教法故。
translation: Thus awakening to enlightenment, thus thus nondiscriminating, and for the sake of this beneficial teaching, they will carry out the practice of enlightenment for incalculably long eons because they hear this teaching.

source_sentence: 若於人天中，　欲受諸果報，　　而能聞是法，　應勤修速證。
translation: If someone in the human or divine realm wants to experience the results and can hear this teaching, they should diligently cultivate it and quickly realize it.

source_sentence: 彼無能降伏，　調御諸眾生，　　能於諸餘眾，　彼恒有威德。
translation: They're incapable of subduing and disciplining sentient beings, and they're capable of constantly possessing authority over other beings.

source_sentence: 彼智善得利，　善得於壽命，　　得值佛出世，　能聞此教故。
translation: Their knowledge is well-procured, and they well attain longevity, so they'll be able to meet the Buddha when he appears in the world and hear this teaching.

source_sentence: 所有諸佛法，　彼知不思議，　　彼為作聲聞，　復得僧功德。
translation: They know and don't deliberate on all the Buddha's teachings, and they become a direct disciple who also attains the merit of a saṃgha.

source_sentence: 捨於一切法，　復捨內自身，　　應聽修多羅，　聞已應覺知。
translation: They abandon all dharmas and abandon themselves internally, so they should listen to the sūtra and realize it after hearing it.

source_sentence: 此法無不說，　是處無所說，　　如是等諸法，　此中如是說。
translation: This teaching is not unexplained, and there's nothing here that's explained, such as these things, which are thus explained here.

source_sentence: 不取亦不捨，　亦無有得失，　　無處可持來，　是法無住處，　　所有過去佛，　彼如是說法，　　若有當來佛，　彼當如是說。
translation: Nothing is grasped, nothing is discarded, there's nothing to be gained or lost, there's nowhere to bring it, this teaching has no abode, all the buddhas of the past thus taught, and if there's a future buddha, he'll thus teach it.

source_sentence: 於十方世界，　現在兩足尊，　　彼所說法教，　亦如是無二。
translation: In the worlds of the ten directions, the two-legged honored one who is present now teaches the Dharma, and so it is, without distinction.

source_sentence: 若有眾生欲，　能說是法者，　　當如我所說，　如是當覺知。
translation: If sentient beings want someone to teach this Dharma, they will do as I've taught, and they will know it this way.

source_sentence: 若不覺此法，　而當得涅槃，　　終不能觸證，　及當住菩提。
translation: If they don't realize this teaching, then they will attain nirvāṇa, will never be able to touch and realize it, and will abide in bodhi.

source_sentence: 此彼皆具足，　此是諸佛見，　　所有如是法，　及如是見處，　　眾生界求時，　難得於出現。
translation: They are both complete, and this is the view of the buddhas that contains such things and the locus of such views that are difficult to appear when sentient beings seek them in the objective realm.

source_sentence: 若覺此諸法，　真實體空寂，　　諸法無有實，　諸法亦無有。
translation: If they realize that these things are truly empty of substance, that there's nothing real about the things, and that the things don't exist.

source_sentence: 若無有法想，　一切有寂靜，　　此彼如實知，　諸法無得處，　　無所有所問，　無所有所說。
translation: If there's no conception of things as existent, and all things are quiescent, they are truly known, and there's nowhere that the qualities are attained, nothing to be asked, and nothing to be explained.

source_sentence: 時彼摩訶薩，　名曰無所有，　　以念於如來，　復問人中上。
translation: That Mahāsattva, who's called 'nonexistent,' then, mindful of the Tathāgata, again asked about the highest of people.

source_sentence: 所說如是法，　不可見而說，　　誰能覺如是，　不可覺知者。
translation: "Such a teaching as this cannot be seen and explained, and who can apprehend such a thing that cannot be apprehended?

source_sentence: 是等多億天，　及諸四部眾，　　合十指爪掌，　寂意而聽聞。
translation: These many millions of gods and the four groups of people put their palms together with their ten fingers and fingertips, and they listen with silent attention.

source_sentence: 彼聞已欣慶，　而無有所得，　　無智及得處，　多眾住是意。
translation: They rejoice when they hear it, but there's nothing to attain, no knowledge, and no place to attain it, and many people abide in this intention.

source_sentence: 若有未知者，　彼等起欲樂，　　發勤精進意，　當得聞已知。
translation: If there are those who don't know, they give rise to a desire, aspiration, and diligence, and will then hear and know.

source_sentence: 如是聞真義，　真智無分別，　　如己無不如，　真復如是說。
translation: Thus hearing the true meaning, true knowledge has no discrimination, is like themselves and nothing less, and is truly thus explained.

source_sentence: 聞諸佛妙法，　所見大神通，　　皆發歡喜意，　當得上菩提。
translation: Hearing the Buddha's wonderful teaching and seeing the great supernormal powers that they see, they all become delighted and will attain supreme enlightenment.

source_sentence: 多有俱致天，　及百那由他，　　已覺自證知，　如我之所說。
translation: Many of the gods and 100 nayutas have realized it for themselves, just as I've described it.

source_sentence: 今我此眾中，　所有聞法者，　　倍有百千數，　已觸證真法，　　皆已共和合，　昔恒沙佛所，　　已聞覺是法。
translation: Now, here among us, there are a hundred thousand times as many people who have heard the teaching, who have touched and realized the true teaching, and who have all come together to realize that this was the teaching heard by the buddhas of the past.

source_sentence: 彼聞今觸證，　　彼此當作佛，　如我今所在，　　當如是說法，　無有於增減。
translation: Now that they've heard it, they've come into contact with it, and they're both considered buddhas, just as I am now, and they will thus teach the Dharma, with nothing to add or subtract.

source_sentence: 是殺害人者，　於往昔生處，　　曾聞如是法，　昔所未曾有。
translation: That person who kills others was born in a place in the past and has heard such a teaching that never existed in the past.

source_sentence: 彼於今得聞，　無所有解釋，　　已入佛神通，　今知於聞義。
translation: Now, they've heard it, explained it away, entered the Buddha's superknowledge, and now they know what it means to hear it.

source_sentence: 見是等大眾，　即厭於自身，　　自見最下類，　知佛神通故，　　復更信深入，　不可思議等，　　彼入已即得。
translation: Seeing this kind of crowd, they become disillusioned with themselves, seeing themselves as the lowest class, and knowing the Buddha's supernormal powers, they then believe in and penetrate further, unfathomably so, and then attain them after entering.

source_sentence: 非法非非法，　　此是佛神通，　諸世間無上，　　覺無分別已，　無所無不得。
translation: What's not right and what's not right, these are the Buddha's supernormal powers, which are unsurpassed in the world, and after realizing that there's no discrimination, there's nothing that can't be attained.

source_sentence: 此害人利根，　如所聞聞已，　　利根向我說，　諸佛之法體。
translation: This harms people's sharp faculties, and after hearing what's heard, the sharp faculties tell me the essence of the buddhas' teaching.

source_sentence: 眾生心頑鈍，　為癡網所覆，　　雖復多時聞，　不知佛神通。
translation: Sentient beings are dull and obstinate, covered by the web of delusion, and even though they've heard much, they don't know the Buddha's supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 我昔曾見佛，　證作人中上，　　覺是大神通，　於後得授記。
translation: I once saw the Buddha, realized that he was the best of men, realized that this was great supernormal power, and was subsequently given a prediction.

source_sentence: 過去八十四，　阿僧祇劫中，　　我值然燈佛，　以知有為法，　　以有所得故。
translation: In the past 84 incalculable eons, I met the Randana Buddha because I knew existential phenomena and because I had attained them.

source_sentence: 為得之所覆，　　而著於我想，　為諸煩惱惑，　　不覺佛神通。
translation: Being hindered by attainment, I was attached to the notion of self, afflicted by afflictions, and didn't realize the Buddha's supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 以有於執著，　　流轉生死中，　數不得邊際。
translation: Because of these attachments, I wander through birth and death, often without ever reaching the limit.

source_sentence: 自餘若不覺，　如是佛神通，　　菩薩摩訶薩，　彼著亦多時。
translation: If they don't perceive the rest of themselves, then bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, will also often be attached to such Buddha's supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 是諸菩薩等，　欲速證菩提，　　寂靜佛神通，　應速願覺入。
translation: Thus, bodhisattvas who want to quickly realize enlightenment should quickly wish to awaken to the tranquil Buddha's supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 如是難調伏，　名為害人者，　　還得利智根，　故彼得不難。」
translation: Such a difficult thing to subdue, which is called harmful, will return to the faculty of insight, so Peter won't find it difficult."

source_sentence: 爾時，眾中無煩天子，即以諸天曼陀羅花而散佛上，合掌恭敬而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: At that point, the gods of the world who were free from trouble scattered flowers from the gods' maṇḍalas on top of the Buddha, put their palms together in respect, and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 以何因緣？
translation: By what causes and conditions?

source_sentence: 是惡心難調殺害人者，如是利根智慧微妙，乃能如是速疾決了。」
translation: Such a sharp faculty of wisdom is subtle enough to quickly resolve the difficulty of regulating evil thoughts that kill people."

source_sentence: 說是語已。
translation: After speaking these words, the Buddha addressed the Worthy Prince.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告無煩天子言：「天子諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed the god of no trouble, saying, "Listen, my lord!

source_sentence: 是惡心難調殺害人者，於過去世曾五百生，受毒蛇身見即害物。
translation: "This is a person whose evil intent is difficult to temper and who kills people. In 500 lifetimes in the past, they were given the body of a viper and saw it harming things.

source_sentence: 受彼身已於日夜中，多有眾生為彼所害，以飢惱故皆食彼盡猶不能足，食已消滅，皆成灰燼。
translation: After receiving that body, many sentient beings were harmed by it day and night, and they all ate it up because of hunger and distress, but they still couldn't get enough, and after eating it, it disappeared and turned to ashes.

source_sentence: 彼以求食不得眠睡，身不安隱惡心更增。
translation: Their desire for food doesn't allow them to sleep, and their body becomes unsettled, and their bad thoughts increase.

source_sentence: 或經日夜半月一月，或經年歲，因惡心故而取命終，即便墮於阿鼻地獄。
translation: Sometimes it takes a day, night, half a month, or year, and their life ends because of their bad thoughts, and they'll fall into the avīci hell even after that.

source_sentence: 生彼處已受大苦惱，百千俱致那由他歲，若捨彼身還復生於見毒蛇中，如是次第經五百世，常當受於見毒蛇身。
translation: After being born there, he'll experience great suffering and distress for a hundred thousand koṭīs and many more years, and if he were to abandon that body and be born among vipers again, he'll spend 500 lifetimes in this order, always suffering the body of a viper in his sights.

source_sentence: 「若捨彼身還復生於阿鼻地獄，以彼惡集如是起故，於最後生彼毒蛇母愛所縛故，殺若干虫與彼令食，食已飽滿身得安樂，便得睡眠晝夜不覺。
translation: "If he were to abandon that body and be born again in the avīci hell, because that's how that bad aggregate arises, then in his final lifetime he'll be born to a viper whose mother is bound by desire, so she'll kill some insects and make them eat, and after they've eaten and filled their bodies, they'll attain well-being and then fall asleep and won't be awake day or night.

source_sentence: 彼睡眠時，其母即為多殺諸虫或至千數，斷其命已置其左右周匝圍繞，復置口邊皆成大聚。
translation: While he's asleep, his mother then kills many of those insects, perhaps as many as a thousand, and after cutting off his life, puts them around him to his left and right, and puts them in a large cluster around his mouth.

source_sentence: 彼睡覺已食彼諸虫潤身飽滿，還得安隱尋復睡眠經七日夜。
translation: After she falls asleep, she eats those insects to nourish her body and fill it up, then she comes back to rest and goes back to sleep for seven days and nights.

source_sentence: 彼母復於七日夜中殺百千虫，置其口邊而為大聚。
translation: That mother then killed a hundred thousand worms during those seven nights, placed them near her mouth, and formed a large clump.

source_sentence: 「彼睡覺已，食彼虫聚而猶未盡，即見其母更殺諸虫，持來聚集更為一聚。
translation: "After he fell asleep, he ate another clump of worms that hadn't yet ended, and then he saw his mother kill more worms, bring them back together, and form another clump.

source_sentence: 彼即生念：『奇哉！
translation: He then had the thought, 'That's amazing!

source_sentence: 我母能為難事，為愛我故，求爾許虫與我令食，然我於今不知厭足，然不食盡不知邊際，我今不應如是求食，而令我母為愛我故為我求食。
translation: My mother could do something difficult for me, and she asked for these worms to feed me because she loved me, but now I don't know that I'm satisfied, and I don't know the limits until I've eaten them all.

source_sentence: 我今於母能作何報？』
translation: What reward can I give to my mother now?'

source_sentence: 「彼於母所起慈愛心，知有益處知有恩義，即生愛心生饒益心。
translation: "When they arouse loving kindness for their mother and know the benefits and know the meaning of kindness, they give rise to loving thoughts and generous thoughts.

source_sentence: 彼資潤身。
translation: They nourish their body.

source_sentence: 復以於母生慈念心稍有柔潤，於即睡眠身心安樂。
translation: Also, because they are slightly nourished by the mindfulness of kindness toward their mother, they immediately fall asleep and experience physical and mental well-being.

source_sentence: 彼時遇有取薪草人皆共見之，即以利斧斷其命根。
translation: When they meet someone gathering wood or grass, they all see them together and use a sharp ax to cut off their life's root.

source_sentence: 「彼命終已，有旃陀羅名曰氣噓，生彼子家還有惡心。
translation: "After his life ended, a candra named exasperation was born to his son's family, and he had bad intentions.

source_sentence: 彼時祖父氣噓死後，氣噓之子復當刑殺。
translation: After his grandfather's death from pneumonia, his son from pneumonia was again tortured and killed.

source_sentence: 復於後時彼氣噓子身復命終，既命終已遂絕此業，有合死者無人刑殺。
translation: After that, that son of pneumonia's body again died, and after his life ended, he ended this activity, and there was no one to torture and kill him when he died together with the others.

source_sentence: 「爾時，大臣啟白王言：『大王當知，其主刑者名曰氣噓，其命已終，其彼有子身亦命終。
translation: "It was then that the minister revealed to the king, "Great king, you should know that the person responsible for the punishment was named 'pneumonia,' and after his life ended, that person's son also had his life end.

source_sentence: 大王當知，今無有人殺合死者。』
translation: You should know, Your Majesty, that there's no one to kill the combined dead.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，彼王告大臣言：『彼氣噓門頗有種族，受彼世業資生已不？』
translation: "It was then that the king told the minister, 'Could that man of pneumonia be of a certain race, one who hasn't been reborn from his worldly activities?'

source_sentence: 臣白王言：『彼氣噓門現有孤子受其世業。』
translation: The ministers said to the king, 'That door of pneumonia now has an orphan son who's subject to his worldly karma.'

source_sentence: 王勅臣言：『汝等可往將彼孤子而來見我。』
translation: The king commanded the ministers, 'You may go and bring that orphaned son to see me.'

source_sentence: 大臣受勅將來見王。
translation: The ministers were commanded to come to the king.

source_sentence: 王勅之言：『童子！
translation: The king commanded him, 'Boy!

source_sentence: 汝今既受氣噓世業資生，云何而不習於刑殺合死之人？』
translation: Now that you've received the results of your karmic retribution from pneumonia, why aren't you accustomed to killing people who are united with death?'

source_sentence: 彼答王言：『敬如王教，我有親屬不聽我殺。
translation: He answered the king, 'Respectfully, just as the king taught, I have family members who won't let me kill them.

source_sentence: 王今若遣伏從來命，我蹔還家須臾復來。』
translation: Now, if the king sends me away to follow my orders, I'll quickly return home and come back in a moment.'

source_sentence: 王言：『童子！
translation: The king said, 'Boy!

source_sentence: 汝可知時宜應速來。』
translation: You may know that it's time to come quickly.'

source_sentence: 彼至家已，所有妻子及諸眷屬皆斷命已，還至王所，而白王言：『大王當知，我之親屬皆已殺盡，更無有人遮我殺者。
translation: When he arrived home, all his wives and retinues had been killed, and he returned to the king and said, 'Great king, you should know that my family members have all been killed, and there's no one left to prevent me from killing them.

source_sentence: 唯願大王勅我所作。』
translation: Please let the king order me to do it.'

source_sentence: 於是即付刀杖殺具，彼仍不受。
translation: He then gave them a sword and bludgeon to kill with, but they still didn't accept it.

source_sentence: 王復勅言：『汝今何故不受刀杖？』
translation: The king then again commanded him, 'Why don't you accept the knife and bludgeon now?'

source_sentence: 彼報王言：『大王！
translation: He reported to the king, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我今既名知刑殺害之人，自有牙齒不假刀杖。
translation: 'Now, I've come to be known as a person who kills by torture and has his own teeth, so I don't need a sword or a stick.

source_sentence: 大王當知，若無齒力彼須刀杖，我有牙齒有合死者，我用齒齧而斷彼命，飲彼血已資潤我身增益氣力。』
translation: You should know, Your Majesty, that if you didn't have the strength of teeth, you'd need a sword and a stick, but I have teeth and teeth that come together to kill someone, and I cut their life with a toothy bite and drink their blood, which then nourishes my body and increases my strength.'

source_sentence: 於是即取合死之人，以齒齧項而斷其命即飲其血，飲其血已倍增氣力，嚴熾威勢倍更增惡。
translation: Then, he takes the person who's been joined to death, severs his life with a toothy gash, and drinks his blood, which increases his strength and burns his might and increases his wrath.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 彼難調伏殺害人者，於彼時間多殺眾生皆飲其血，惡心嚴熾心智猛利，如是利智得聞菩薩名無所有，請問世尊空義斷漏，不起煩惱顛倒分別，斷瞋恚意慳貪妬嫉，無恩義處悉能破除，得無言說。
translation: That person who has difficulty controlling people and kills many sentient beings and drinks their blood, has a fierce evil mind and a sharp mind and wisdom, and thus has the sharpest wisdom to hear the bodhisattva's name and nothingness, ask the Bhagavān about the meaning of emptiness and the elimination of contaminants, stop afflictions and mistaken discernment, end anger, mind, stinginess, greed, and jealousy, and completely eliminate the ungrateful places and attain inexpressibility.

source_sentence: 從佛所聞解說之時，聞已更復增益利智，復入諸佛大神通事，故得如是勝利功德。」
translation: When I heard and understood what the Buddha taught, I gained further insight after hearing it, and I further entered into the great supernormal abilities of the buddhas, which enabled me to attain such excellent qualities."

source_sentence: 爾時，復有教示菩薩摩訶薩從坐而起，整理衣服，偏袒右邊右膝著地，合掌向佛，欲有所問。
translation: At the time, another teaching bodhisattva Mahāsattva rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, bared his right side and knelt on his right knee, folded his palms, and approached the Buddha with the intention of asking a question.

source_sentence: 彼合掌時佛神力故，水陸所生種種妙花有開敷者，色香微妙滿其手中，即生歡喜踊躍無量，以歡喜意用彼諸花而散佛上，再三散已，而白佛言：「世尊！
translation: When he closed his palms, the Buddha's miraculous power caused a variety of wonderful flowers to bloom on land and water that were delicately colored and fragrant to fill his hands, and he rejoiced and leaped for joy, scattering those flowers on top of the Buddha with a joyful intention.

source_sentence: 今此難調殺害人者，已曾發於菩提心耶？」
translation: Has this person who is difficult to control and kills people ever given rise to the intention to achieve enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 時佛告言：「汝善男子！
translation: The Buddha then told them, "You good sons!

source_sentence: 宜應還問此難調伏殺害人者，是善男子當為汝說。」
translation: It's appropriate to ask again about this difficult-to-control killer, and this is a good man who will explain it for you."

source_sentence: 爾時，教示菩薩還復合掌，而問之言：「汝善男子！
translation: At that point, the teaching bodhisattva again put his palms together and asked, "You good sons!

source_sentence: 已曾發於菩提心耶？」
translation: Have you already aroused the intention to achieve enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 彼即答言：「善男子！
translation: He then replied, "Good man!

source_sentence: 知我今即是發菩提心清淨無濁，如我聞佛大神通已即斷諸惡，而復得聞此無所有菩薩所問、世尊解釋，聞已信受念持觀察無有疑網。
translation: "Knowing that I have now aroused the mind of enlightenment that's pure and unsullied, as I did after hearing the Buddha's great supernormal powers, I ended all evil and then was able to hear the Bhagavān's explanation of the questions asked by the unsurpassed bodhisattvas, and after hearing it, I believed, accepted, maintained, and observed it without any web of doubt.

source_sentence: 於世尊說一切諸法空無有我，無生無滅無有境界，無境界處無虛空處。
translation: The Bhagavān explained that all things are empty of self, have no arising or ceasing, have no objective realm, and have no objective realm or space.

source_sentence: 汝善男子！
translation: You good sons!

source_sentence: 於如此處欲起何心而有所聞？」
translation: What mind does one want to give rise to and hear in this place?"

source_sentence: 教示菩薩復問彼言：「汝善男子！
translation: The bodhisattva who instructed him then asked him, "You good sons!

source_sentence: 汝於眾生幾所成熟於菩提耶？」
translation: How many of the sentient beings have you ripened for enlightenment?"

source_sentence: 彼即答言：「善男子！
translation: He then replied, "Good man!

source_sentence: 我於無量不思議等不可瞋恚諸眾生者，成熟安置菩提種子，於無邊劫當更成熟所有眾生。
translation: I've ripened the seeds of bodhi in measureless inconceivable and other nonangry sentient beings, and I will ripen them in an infinite eon for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 譬如虛空多所容受，佛法亦爾容受無量。
translation: Just as space has plenty of room for it, so the Buddha's teaching has measureless room for it.

source_sentence: 若有信受彼能成熟，亦可成熟一切眾生，不著邪徑當作惡業。
translation: If someone who believes and accepts it can ripen it, they can also ripen all sentient beings and not create bad karma by adhering to wrong paths.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 我已為一切眾生利益安樂而為攀緣，今向汝說無有虛妄，佛自證知。
translation: "I've made this climb for the benefit and welfare of all sentient beings, and now I'm telling you that it's not false and that the Buddha himself knows it.

source_sentence: 若佛世尊不授記者，我於菩提我即自記。
translation: If the Bhagavān doesn't give this report, I'll remember for myself that I'm in the position to achieve enlightenment.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我已信入菩薩種子，已住信忍無疑無惑，於此諸佛大神通中，此是一切諸菩薩等無有所著，發菩提心而為根本。
translation: "I have faithfully entered the bodhisattva seed, have abided in faith and tolerance without doubt or confusion, and among the great supernormal powers of these buddhas, these are all bodhisattvas who have no attachment and whose arousal of the mind of enlightenment is fundamental.

source_sentence: 若增長已次第能證菩提之果及一切智，一切佛法當覺當知，次第成熟無量眾生，於菩提道亦當成就，住於菩薩不動法中。
translation: If I develop and then realize in turn the fruit of enlightenment and all cognition, I'll know and understand all the Buddha's teachings, ripen measureless sentient beings in turn, and accomplish the path to enlightenment while abiding in the bodhisattva's immovable state.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: "Good sons!

source_sentence: 如是，如是！
translation: So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 無異無別，能如是者願生諸相，然諸眾生有厭離想得無疑惑，願當入佛大神通處自見於我少分。
translation: Without difference or distinction, those who can thus vow to give rise to characteristics, yet sentient beings who are disillusioned with the idea of freedom will attain it without doubt, hoping to enter the Buddha's place of great supernormal powers and see a small part of themselves in me.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 其佛神通有無量故。
translation: The Buddha's powers are therefore limitless.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 諸佛世尊於大神通能決了見，諸菩薩等若未得忍唯以信行，若諸菩薩有得忍者，於佛神通少分已入。」
translation: The Bhagavān sees the great supernormal powers with certainty, and if bodhisattvas have yet to attain patience, they simply practice it with faith; if bodhisattvas have attained ninjutsu, they have entered into a small measure of the Buddha's supernormal powers."

source_sentence: 爾時，以佛神通力故，於此大地六種震動安樂潤澤，無一眾生有驚怖者，一切音樂不鼓自鳴。
translation: At the time, because of the Buddha's supernormal powers, this earth was comfortably moistened by six kinds of earthquakes, and there wasn't a single sentient being who was frightened, and all the music didn't beat of its own accord.

source_sentence: 上虛空雨優波羅花、鉢頭摩花、拘勿頭花、分陀利花。
translation: Up in the sky it rains down upwards the upāsaka flower, the padma flower, the kovidāra flower, and the puṇḍarīka flower.

source_sentence: 於虛空中自然而有種種天衣懸垂而現，燒眾天人所有諸香。
translation: In the sky, various celestial garments naturally hang down and appear, and they burn the fragrances of gods and humans.

source_sentence: 彼一切眾所有三千大千世界，彼菩薩等不知邊際，彼等皆悉掬於此花，以散佛上，如是再三及散此眾。
translation: From all of them, there are 3,000 great thousand worlds that bodhisattvas don't know the limits of, and they all scoop up these flowers and scatter them on top of the Buddha, and so on and so forth, scattering them to this multitude.

source_sentence: 於時復有十六俱致百千那由他等蓮花，猶如車輪，從地踊出，彼花臺中有菩薩坐，皆悉具足三十二相。
translation: At the time, another 16 lotus flowers that were like chariots and hundreds of thousands of nayutas rose out of the ground, and there were bodhisattvas sitting on that flower dais, all fully endowed with the thirty-two marks.

source_sentence: 彼諸菩薩各從花下，還以此花而散佛上，花供養已，合掌禮敬向佛而住。
translation: Each of those bodhisattvas got down from the flower and scattered this flower on top of the Buddha, and after making an offering with the flower, they put their palms together, paid homage to the Buddha, and stayed there.

source_sentence: 爾時，教示菩薩承佛威神，而問彼等諸菩薩言：「善男子等！
translation: At that point, the teaching bodhisattva acknowledged the Buddha's authority and asked those bodhisattvas, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝從何來？」
translation: Where did you come from?"

source_sentence: 彼菩薩言：「我從十方阿僧祇等諸世界中，奉侍禮敬阿僧祇佛，聽聞法已而來至此。」
translation: The bodhisattva said, "I've come here from among the incalculably long worlds in the ten directions to serve and venerate the incalculably long Buddha after hearing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 教示菩薩復問之言：「善男子等！
translation: The bodhisattva who instructed him then asked, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝聞何法？」
translation: What teaching have you heard?"

source_sentence: 彼答之言：「我等亦聞有菩薩名無所有問、佛為解釋，亦如此間釋迦如來所解說法，亦復如是無有增減。
translation: They replied, "We've also heard that there's a bodhisattva named Nothing who asks a question, and the Buddha explains it for us, and so is the explanation given by the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, which has nothing to add or subtract.

source_sentence: 彼菩薩亦名無所有，於問彼佛。
translation: That bodhisattva is also called 'impermanent,' and he asked the Buddha about it.

source_sentence: 彼佛世尊亦如是說，不起煩惱令斷疑惑，令作光明令近諸佛，及一切智無等等法。」
translation: The Bhagavān also thus explains that it doesn't cause affliction, stops doubt, makes light available, and brings near the buddhas, and has all the knowledge of peerless dharmas."

source_sentence: 爾時，大眾生希有心，皆作是念：「彼諸人等善得人身善得壽命，值佛出世隨順諸佛，聞無所有菩薩所問如是等法，信入奉行，無相無得不起煩惱。
translation: At that point, a rare thought arose in the crowd, and they all thought, "Those people who have well attained a human body and well attained a life span, who happened to be born in the world to follow the buddhas, who heard this kind of question from an unsurpassed bodhisattva, believed, entered, and approved it, had no characteristics, attained nothing, and didn't become afflicted.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今善得大利，善得人身善得壽命。
translation: "Now, I've well attained great rewards, and I've well attained a human life and well attained a life span.

source_sentence: 我等今者，聞無所有菩薩所問、佛解釋時，聞於耳根如聞信解，無有疑惑有所觸證。
translation: Now, when we hear the questions of the unsurpassed bodhisattvas and the Buddha's explanations, we hear them in our ears and faculties as we hear and believe them, and we have no doubts or confusions and come to understand them.

source_sentence: 我今得知一切智已，亦當如是為諸眾生而作利益得善普覆。
translation: Now, after I've learned omniscience, I will likewise work for the benefit of sentient beings and obtain a good and universal covering.

source_sentence: 我等今者，假使能以一切珍寶，滿此三千大千世界持用布施，以如是等猶不能報是無所有菩薩之德，而不現身能問如來寂靜之法，能斷無量眾生疑惑顛倒之意。
translation: Now, even if we were able to use all the treasures in this 3,000 great thousand worlds to support and give alms, we still wouldn't be able to repay these unsurpassed bodhisattva virtues without physically being able to ask the Tathāgata about the quiescent Dharma and end the mistaken thoughts of doubt and confusion in measureless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我等於今當以何事而供養此不現身者？」
translation: What will we offer to this unmanifest body now?"

source_sentence: 爾時，無所有菩薩作如是言：「諸善男子！
translation: At that point, the unexcelled bodhisattva said in this way, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝等若聞如是等法能信解者，即為已作上妙供養一切諸佛及諸菩薩。
translation: "If you hear such things and understand them, you will have made sublime offerings to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 我今所問、佛為解釋，汝等若得無疑惑處，無熱惱處，成菩提時，為諸眾生作利益故，眾生執著令解脫故，亦為化彼惡心怨讐害人者故。
translation: Now, when I ask a question and the Buddha explains it for you, if you attain a state of no doubt and no burning, when you achieve enlightenment, it will be for the benefit of sentient beings, for the liberation of their attachments, and for the transformation of those with evil intentions who hate and hate people.

source_sentence: 唯若干事以是故問勸請如來，我今已顯諸佛法教，已照一切無明黑闇。」
translation: There are only a few things for which I would ask and request the Tathāgata, and now I've shown that the teachings of the buddhas have illuminated the darkness of ignorance."

source_sentence: 爾時，惡心難調怨讐殺害人者，見於如是大神通已：「如彼所知不取上下，心得調順無有喜怒。」
translation: At the time, someone with a malicious mind that's hard to control and who resents and kills people saw this great superknowledge and said, "As they know, they don't look up or down, and their mind is tempered without joy or anger."

source_sentence: 說此語時，難調怨讐即於彼處踊身虛空，而作是言：「諸善男子！
translation: When he said that, the hard-to-control enemy then rises up into space and says, "Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切諸法猶如幻化，無有真實、分別所作，諸法實體如如不動無有顛倒，是故汝等所有諸想住持建立。
translation: "All dharmas are illusory, lacking real, discriminated action, and the substance of dharmas is as it is, immovable, and without error; therefore, all of your conceptions are maintained and established.

source_sentence: 如是等想無有實想，是顛倒想非有實想，是故汝今已得至於無疑惑處，亦當得於無礙辯才。
translation: Such conceptions have no real conceptions, and these are mistaken conceptions that don't have real conceptions; therefore, now that you've reached the state of no doubt, you will also attain unhindered eloquence.

source_sentence: 汝等已脫諸疑惑故，求菩提時不由於他，常當自體一切開悟。」
translation: Because you've freed yourselves from the mental disturbances of doubt, when you seek enlightenment, you won't rely on others; you'll always achieve total enlightenment in your own body."

translation: It was then that Nandika, harboring a grudge, said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今即是授記，以蒙世尊稱歎善哉。
translation: "Now, I've been given this prediction because the Bhagavān praised me as good.

source_sentence: 雖然世尊但與我記，為此大眾令得踊躍，心意歡喜更發勝心不怯弱故。
translation: Although the Bhagavān has only given me this assurance, it's because I want to make this crowd rejoice and rejoice, and I want to be resolute and not fainthearted.

source_sentence: 我今不見彼法歡喜踊躍。
translation: Now, I don't see that teaching, so I rejoice and jump for joy.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 一切諸法無有思念，無有真實，分別所起，以分別故而有莊嚴，猶如幻化、如夢所見、如旋火輪。
translation: All dharmas are without contemplation, without reality, produced by discrimination, and adorned because of that discrimination, just like illusory transformations, like what's seen in a dream, and like a whirling wheel of fire.

source_sentence: 我於彼等如實覺知，如佛世尊為無所有菩薩解釋，我亦隨順無隨順故。」
translation: I truly perceive them as the Bhagavān explained them to the nonexistent bodhisattvas, and I also conform to what's not conformed."
